content.description: Thin pulls right off the deck lead to positive hold climbing above on good rock.
content.location: This is the left hand route that starts off the same boulder as King Tut.  Some slick rock and thin edges will be in your face, along with a bolt.

climbs.name: King Tut Vs. John Wayne Live at Caesars Palace

content.description: Start on the right side of the boulder at the base.  Good rock and some neat moves lead to easier climbing above.  This route is just right of Pharaohs On Fungi, the thinner and slightly harder route to the left.
content.location: This route starts up on the next level heading up the base of the Eye formation.  Do a short chimney move or two to get to the base.

content.description:
Full disclosure:  I did not do this route while up there, but I'm adding it for completeness of the area.

A clean-ish looking finger and thin hands crack that looks like it will eat up gear.  Rock looks good, but does have some plates and flakes in and on the route that may be loose.
content.protection: Gear including nuts and cams to about 1.5"  Lower off from open shuts at the anchor.
content.location: The obvious thin crack that is not super chossy on the middle left of the formation.  Lies between Jackal Headed Woman and the Pharaohs route.

content.description: Clip a couple bolts and stare down the intimidating 19 inch roof.  Surmount the roof and follow the bolts to the anchors.  This route climbs up to near the left side of the actual Eye.  Good rock and neat moves make this one of the best on the cliff.
content.location: Scramble to the left end of the corridor that hosts the previous routes.  You will also need to go up a tier to get to the base.  You can chimney up for about 10feet or scramble around to the East from the base.  The start of the route is directly below a small roof  about 20 feet up with a line of bolts leading to it.

content.description: A low and thin crux on sharp holds leads to easier climbing above.  Good rock and well protected.  Staying off the pillar behind you and over your left shoulder will keep it true to the grade.
content.protection: 5 bolts to a thin crack that you will not need any pro for.  Open shuts at top.
content.location: As you crawl toward the various routes below the Eye, this will be the first one you encounter.  Bolts and anchor in full view.
